episode_title: 319 - The One With The Tiny T-shirt

content.description: Central Perk, Gunther is pouring Rachel coffee.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Say Rachel, I was wondering if you’d like to go to a movie with me sometime. As my lover! Nnnsch, to out there. Maybe you’d just like to ah, get something to eat with me sometime? As my lover.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! All right, let’s go shoppin’!!

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Um, y’know, before we go ah, there’s something I need to say.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: I’ve kinda of had this ah, this crush on you. (Rachel is shocked) But since you were with Ross, I-I didn’t do anything about it. But, now that you’re not, I’d really like to ask you out sometime. So-so that’s-that’s what I’m doing, now.
(Gunther gets this hurt expression on his face and goes into the back room)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Umm…
(She’s interrupted by a loud crash and the sound of braking dishes. Followed quickly by another crash. Everyone turns and looks at the back room, as Gunther emerges.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I dropped a cup.

content.description: The hallway between the two apartments, Pete and Monica are returning from their date.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: …so y’know, that’s why, within a few years, that voice recognition is gonna be pretty much standard on any computer you buy. Y’know, so you could be like-like, ‘Wash my car.’ ‘Clean my room.’ It’s not gonna be able to do any of those things, but it’ll understand what you’re saying.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, this is so great.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Yeah, it was.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right then. (He leans in to kiss her goodnight, but she quickly kisses him on the cheek and pats his shoulder.) Bye.
(She goes into her apartment and sees Chandler, Phoebe, and Ross sitting there.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello, people who do not live here.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi! Hello!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I gave you a key for emergencies!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We were out of Doritos .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, how’d the date go with Mr. Millionaire?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mr. Millionaire, new from Snooty Playthings! Third wife sold separately.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s great! I mean we have such a good time together! He’s so funny, and sooo sweet, and I’m not attracted to him at all!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Still?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Noo!! It’s driving me crazy. I mean every other way he’s like the perfect guy, he has everything. Plus! He actually has everything.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Life-sized Imperial Storm Troopers from Sharper Image ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Two.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow!! Can Joey and I put them on and fight?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! (He dances around the dinner table and exits)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I guess he musta gotten the part in that play.

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, either that, or Gloria Estefan was right, eventually, the rhythm is going to get you.

content.description: A Theatre, Joey is arriving to rehearse the play he’s in.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Joe. How’s it going?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good. (He sets his stuff down and starts talking to Kate, another cast member.) Hey.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, so you’re playing Adrienne, huh?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Yes. Are you one of the retarded cousins?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, no. Ah, I playing your husband, Victor. I’m Joey Tribianni.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Hi, nice to meet you. Kate Miller.
(She goes over to the snack table, and Joey quickly runs over and pours her a cup of coffee.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So the ah, play’s pretty great, huh?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Oh, yeah. I love Jennifer Van Murray’s work. She’s so brilliantly incisive when it comes to deconstructing the psyche of the American middle class.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, forget about it. She rocks!

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Where do I know you from?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dr. Drake Remoray. Days of Our Lives . Voted most datable neurosurgeon by Teen Beat.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: No, that’s not it. So, you’re a soap actor? Well this must be pretty exciting for you to be in a real play, hmm?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I’ve done plays before. I’m a serious actor.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: That info-mercial! For the milk carton spout thing! You’re-you’re-you’re the guy that doesn’t know how to pour milk!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See, I actually can pour milk, but I got you believing that I couldn’t. Now, see, that’s acting.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Right, at the end, you choked on a cookie.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, that was real.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is telling Phoebe about Mark, as Gunther eavesdrops behind them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! I cannot believe Mark asked you out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What, so what are you gonna tell him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I told him I would think about it, but I’m gonna tell him no.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh.
(Gunther tries to swoop in to ask Rachel out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean I think I’d say no to anybody right now. (Hearing this Gunther swoops back to cleaning tables.) Oh, but it was so strange. I mean I’m standing there with this charming, cute guy, who’s asking me to go out with him, which I’m allowed to do, and I felt guilty. Y’know, like I’d be cheating on Ross or something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow. So, okay, maybe that means that, you’re not over Ross yet and you have issues with your father.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t have any issues with my Father.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so it’s probably just the Ross thing then.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is telling Chandler about Kate.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I hate this woman!! I hate her! She told everyone in the company about that info-mercial, and now they all keep asking me to open their drinks. Okay, and whenever I can’t do it, they’re all like-like laughing at me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So Rachel called. Wants to see me. Going over in a minute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, what-what do you think she wants?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, maybe the crazy fog has lifted and she realises that life without me… a-sucks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s possible. You are very loveable, I’d miss you if I broke up with you. (Ross glares at him) I was just trying to be supportive.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then be supportive like a guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If I broke up with you, I’d miss you.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is there as Ross enters, walking very confidently.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You ah, wanted to see me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Ahh, here’s a box of your stuff. (hands him a box)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, y’know, it’s just like hats, and a shirt, and CD’s, just sort of stuff that you’ve left here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing? Are you trying to hurt me? Or something?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Ross, it, it just seems that y’know it’s time we-we y’know, move on. I mean, I mean don’t’ you think?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, I do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I-I really do. (takes a dinosaur mug out of the box) Hey! This-this was a gift?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, you got that for free from the museum gift shop.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s still a gift! I got it from the gift shop !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, all right, give me the mug! I’ll keep the mug.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!! Y’know-y’know don’t do me any favours. In fact, where, where’s the rest of my stuff?! Huh? Like-like my umm, (picks up a book) Hey, this book is mine!! And-and-and, and that T-shirt you sleep in? I’d like that back too. Yes, I do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know how much I love that T-shirt! You never even where that T-shirt!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m just trying to help you, move on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you are a petty man. You are a petty, petty…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Petty…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Petty… (goes into her room)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Petty…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Petty…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Petty…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Small…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Small… (Rachel comes back into the living room and catches Ross mocking her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You are so just doing this out of spite.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Awwwahuh, no, no, no!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m-I’m gonna wear this all the time! I love this shirt!! (he kisses the shirt)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You have not worn that T-shirt since you were 15!! It doesn’t even fit you anymore!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: yeah-yeah-yeah!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh, okay, okay! (He quickly takes off his sweater in order to put on the T-shirt. It’s an old ‘Frankie says relax’ T-shirt, that barely fits him. Rachel nods her head in approval of the new look.) If you don’t mind I’m gonna the rest of my stuff, and relax, in my favourite shirt. (Starts to leave) You have a pleasant evening. (He exits and leaves the door open.)

content.description: Central Perk, the gang minus Rachel and Ross are talking to Pete.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, you’re like a zillionaire? (Pete smiles and nods)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And you’re our age. You’re our age.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what, you should like, you should buy a state and then just name it after yourself.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: What like Pete Dakota?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, or, or, or, Mississ-Pete.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, oh, I got it! Pete-Chicago.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s not a state Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, and Mississ-Pete is?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I got to go, so ah, I’ll see you guys later.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re our age!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: So ah, we on for tomorrow?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Absolutely! (He goes to kiss her, but she stops him and rubs his head and says…) Now get out of here you!! (Pete leaves) (to the gang) Okay, I’m running out of places I can touch him! Look, is there something wrong with me? I mean why am I only attracted to guys where there’s no future? Either they’re too old, or they’re too young, and then there’s Pete who’s-who’s crazy about me, and who’s absolutely perfect for me, and there’s like zip going on! I mean, seriously, does it sound like something’s wrong with me?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, kinda.

content.description: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are rehearsing for the play.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Happy?! Is that what I’m supposed to be Vic? Happy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, why don’t you tell me what you’re supposed to be! Huh? Because I sure as hell can’t figure it out! I talk to you and nothin’. You look at me, and it’s nothin’. (He kisses her) Nothing.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Tasty! I’m really starting to feel like you guys have a history, it’s-it’s nice.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: I have a question about this scene.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Well, I don’t understand why Adrienne’s attracted to Victor.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Peel the onion. First of all, he’s good looking.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: I think my character’s gonna need a little bit more of reason than that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey, how about this one. Ah, it’s says so in the script! Y’know ah, I-I don’t know why my character likes you either, I mean it says in the script here that you’re a bitch.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: It doesn’t say that in the script.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It does in mine!

content.description: The Hallway, Chandler and Ross are returning from working out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can blow dry it. I can put gel on it. It doesn’t matter, I still wind up with this little (pats the flat spot on the back of his head) cowlicky thing on the middle part of my head. It’s so annoying. Does it bug you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You bug me.
[Rachel comes out of her apartment, followed by Mark, and they leave on their date, without saying a word to Ross. Ross is stunned.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is there any chance you didn’t see that?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is watching a basketball game, Ross is staring out the peephole.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross! You gotta stop! Okay?! You can’t just stare through the peep hole for three hours! You’re gonna get peep eye!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I knew it! I knew it! I always knew she liked him! Y’know, she’d say no, but here we are! Right? We just broke up, first thing she does!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You didn’t just break up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, it’s been like three weeks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You slept with somebody three hours after you thought you broke up. I mean bullets have left guns slower!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here they come, here they come. Oh-ho, if she kisses him goodnight, I’m gonna kill myself, I swear. I can’t, I can’t watch this. (turns away, then quickly turns to look again) Come on, date over! Date over! Uh-oh, here we go, she’s going in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s going in. Wait! He’s going in! He’s going in!! The door’s closed! I, I can’t see anything but the door closed!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And the inventor of the door rests happily in his grave.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I have to do something. I mean, I have, I have to stop it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stop what?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, but I ah, I have the feeling that my being there will do it. I’ll go over and I will borrow something. Juice!! I need juice!!
(He starts to exit, but Chandler tries to stop him by climbing on his back and grabbing hold of the foosball table.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!! You can’t!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, they must be stopped!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am your friend, and I am not gonna let you do this!! (Ross is now dragging Chandler and the foosball table to the door) You are surprisingly strong!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I need juice! People need juice!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look man!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: People need juice!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen to me!! (Chandler turns him around and closes and holds the door shut with his feet.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Juice, I need…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s moving on! Okay, if it’s not this guy, it’s gonna be somebody else! And unless you’re thinking about subletting my peep hole, you are going to have to get used to the fact that the relationship is over! Okay, man? It’s over.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s just I miss her so much.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know. (He rubs Ross’s head)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is pouring Mark some coffee.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Why do all you’re coffee mugs have numbers on the bottom?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. That’s so Monica can keep track. That way if one on them is missing, she can be like, ‘Where’s number 27?!’
(She sits down, and Mark leans over and kisses her. Rachel doesn’t react. He tries it again, and Rachel jumps back quickly.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what?

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: No. And I don’t think I’m gonna want to.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t do this.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Yep. Yep, that’s what I didn’t want to know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, oh, Mark, I’m doing this for the wrong reasons, y’know? I’m just doing it to get back at Ross. I’m sorry, it’s not very fair to you.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Ahh! Fair, schmair! Y’know? Look, if you want to get back at Ross, I am here for you. Really? No-no, I say-I say, I say we get back at him right on this couch. Right here!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God. I’m sorry about this.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: That’s okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You sure?

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Yeah. I can just go home and get back at him by myself.

content.description: A Hospital Reception, Monica and Pete are there.

content.speaker: Spokeswoman
content.text: …has become the penicillin of the twenty-first century. And so today, this hospital is about to take major steps toward leading that revolution. It is truly ironic, on one hand consider the size…

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Hey, can I ask you something?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Where are we?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, with all these doctors and nurses, I’m gonna say, midget rodeo.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Just tell me the truth.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Umm, y’know, I don’t think, I don’t think I told you this, but umm, I just got out of a really serious relationship.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Oh, yeah. Wasn’t that like a year ago?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So I did tell you. Okay, y’know, that really isn’t the thing. Umm, the thing is that, right now I’m just in a place in my life where I need to focus on me. Y’know what I mean?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Oh, yeah. I know that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I so wanna be attracted to you.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: But you’re not. Okay, good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Y’know what, don’t be. This is not, don’t be, ‘cause it’s not so bad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s not?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I know I’m no John Bon Jovi, (Monica laughs) or someone who find attractive, I’m just, I think, y’know, that you might end up feeling differently.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, um, look I-I don’t want this to come our wrong, but ah, you seem awfully confident for a guy I just told I wasn’t attracted too.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Yeah, stupidly charming isn’t’ it? Well listen let’s, you wanna get something to eat? ‘Cause this place is kinda de pressing. (they start to leave)

content.speaker: Spokeswoman
content.text: And the man who made all this possible… Mr. Peter Becker.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: One second.
(He takes the scissors, cuts the ribbon, shakes her hand, posses for the picture, and leaves.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is sitting in one of the black chairs, and turns to face the other one.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t think this town is big enough for both of us to relax in. (He blows on his hand) Draw!! (He quickly pulls the lever to raise the foot rest, like a gunfighter in a Western.)
(Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I wasn’t doing anything. (Joey starts angrily throwing his stuff down.) Uh-oh, what did she do now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just because she went to Yale drama, she thinks she’s like the greatest actress since, since, sliced bread!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, Sliced Bread, a wonderful Lady MacBeth.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: God, I just, I hate her! I hate her!! With her, ‘Oh, I’m so talented.’ and ‘Oh, I’m so pretty,’ and ‘Ooh, I smell so good.’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think somebody has a crush on somebody.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Chandler, can we please stay focused on my problem here?! Y’know?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m talking about you. You big, big freak.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. (realises) Ohh. Ohh, you’re out of your mind.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you have nothing but talk about her for the last 48 hours! If you were in a school yard you’d be pulling her pigtails and pushing her down now!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah?! Then how come I keep thinking about her in all these sexual scenarios and stuff huh?!

content.description: The Theatre, Kate and Joey are rehearsing the same scene as before.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Happy?! Is that what I’m supposed to be Vic? Happy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, why don’t you tell me what you’re supposed to be! Huh? Because I sure as hell can’t figure it out! I talk to you and it’s nothin’. You look at me, and nothin’. (He kisses her, more passionately this time) Nothing.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: You guys make me fly! High! Okay, we’re gonna pick it up here, tomorrow.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Well, that was ah…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Better?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Yeah! Yeah, it was definitely an improvement. G’night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, Kate?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You ah, you forgot your shoes.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: I’m probably gonna need those. Huh? (she giggles some more)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, listen you ah…

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Hmm?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …feel like getting a cup of coffee?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Umm.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Kate?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Yep.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: You ready to go?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Very nice. Very nice. (he walks away)

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: So umm, I’ll see you tomorrow, huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah sure, goodnight.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is in the kitchen chopping vegetables. Chandler and Phoebe are sitting in the living room.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! (Chandler looks up, startled) Why isn’t it Spiderman? Y’know like Goldman, Silverman…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘Cause it’s-it’s not his last name.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It isn’t?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it’s not like, like Phil Spiderman. He’s a spider, man. Y’know like ah, like Goldman is a last name, but there’s no Gold Man.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay. There should be Gold Man!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Rach, how was work?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, great. Although I did sit down where there wasn’t a chair.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: By the way, Ross dropped by a box of your stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well, I guess I had that one coming. I’m just gonna throw it out, it’s probably just a bunch of shampoo and… (she opens the box and stops)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Something wrong?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Nothing. (She smiles and goes into her room.)
content.parenthetical: She takes the T-shirt out of the box and holds it to her chest and take a deep breath.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Phoebe and Chandler are sitting in the black chairs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, ahh, what kind of powers would Gold Man have?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay well, he would turn things to gold.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What about things that are already gold?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ahh, his work is done.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, let’s play my game now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. All right you yellow-bellied-lilly-livered-DRAW!! (they both kick up the foot rests like an old fashioned gun fight.)
